ent.origin: 1950s: an invented name, based on xerography.

p.def: A xerographic copying process: printing methods include acrylic printing and colour Xerox.
p.eg: On the ground, LynxOS is also used on HP LaserJet printers and Xerox copiers.

p.def: Copy (a document) by the Xerox process:
p.eg: I shall have the typescript xeroxed today.
